author: By     Sarah E. Needleman
title: EA hires former ‘Assassin’s Creed’ producer to run two studios
text:
By
Electronic Arts called on a former studio head at Ubisoft with ties to big franchises such as “Assassin’s Creed” to lead two of its own development teams, including a new one tasked with creating original intellectual property.
Jade Raymond will run a new EA studio in Canada and take over a second that will work on a new “Star Wars” game. She is the second woman that EA EA, +2.04% has named to an executive post this month, a noteworthy move at a time when the industry is grappling with criticism over how it treats women.
Earlier in July, EA named Samantha Ryan to run its mobile division after hiring her in March as a senior vice president and group general manager.
Raymond started out in the industry as a programmer, and most recently was managing director of Ubisoft Toronto. She has production credits for two other well-known Ubisoft franchises: “Watch Dogs” and “Tom Clancy’s Splinter Cell.”
At the new studio, called Motive, Raymond will focus on fresh games and characters, an important move considering the marketplace is inundated with sequels. EA produces many of them, including the annual “Madden NFL” franchise and the shooter game “Battlefield.” Motive will be based in Raymond’s home town of Montreal, sharing office space and collaborating with EA’s BioWare team, which is well known for the its “Mass Effect” franchise.
